properties.fair-split-eq: for every address `a` in `payees`, `released[a] + releasable(a) == (totalReceived * shares[a]) / totalShares`.
properties.fair-split-geq: for every address `a` in `payees`, `released[a] <= (totalReceived + totalReleased) / totalShares`.
properties.release-not-revert: for all addresses `a` in `payees`, if `releasable(a) > 0`, then `release(a)` does not revert.
properties.releasable-balance-check: for all addresses `addr` in `payees`, `releasable(addr)` is less than or equal to the balance of the contract.
properties.releasable-sum-balance: the sum of the releasable funds for every addresses is equal to the balance of the contract.
properties.release-release-revert: two consecutive calls to `release` for the same address `a`, without there being any transfer to the contract in between calls, revert on the second call.
properties.swappable-call-order: two different calls in any order to `release` yield the same contract state.
properties.zero-dust: the contract should always be able to release all funds with no leftovers.
